author: Retrobilly6120
title: Awsome!
review:
Thank you to Jan, for sending me this set from Lego HQ. It was the perfect gift and such a surprise its a great item. A must have!

 

Although very simple to build, its plain white with black markings on the chest plate. Great Mini figure to have on display.

author: blazetrooper501
title: Boba fett promo
review: This boba fett promo minifigure was at a few events like the toyfair,SDCC,and star wars celebration V.This is a neat little figure I got for free at celebration V.Very easy build just a minifigure and I like the fact that TLC used the old boba fett helmet for him because the new slave 1 was out at the time with the new boba fett.I would try to get this for a good price you could try sites like bricklink or ebay overall I really like this minifigure.

author: Zuma
title: Boba Fett in white for collectors.
review:
This is the printed poly bag promotional release. There was also a  limited edition released  of 150 white boba fett minifig's in a plain poly bag along with a copy of the 2010 Limited Edition Star Wars catalog that was an exclusive Toy Fair release

The ploy bag promotional release is for the 30th anniversary of The Empire Strikes Back, and has been given away free at various toy fairs , events, and shops.

The minifig is the usual minifig - 3 parts of the head, torso and legs, and the Boba Fett helmet and gun, so a total of 5 pieces.  The fact it is in white and a limited release that currently has not been available in all counties, makes it unique. As a minifig it does nothing different to any other Boba Fett minifig.

The price of these has decreased as they have become more widely available when given away at different shops and events. Expect to pay under Â£15 for this in the sealed bag. At this price, it is not too expensive for something that is currently on limited release. However, you are able to buy Star Wars sets for this amount. Thus, although it is not super rare, it really is an item for collectors as it will look good in your collection or on display. It can be used for playing with, however, you are able to buy Star Wars sets for the same amount that will provide a lot more playability and building experience.

Overall, unless you want to add a unique and collectable minfig to your collection, then I would recommend buying a set, especially for children. For collectors, this makes a worthwhile addition to any star wars minifig collection and display, hence a 2 star rating.

author: The_Reviewer
title: Rare,but worth it.
review:
I got this on Amazon for $28,kinda pricey but worth it since this is rare and it used to be $250!

Pros

  • Old Boba Fett Version (jetpack attached to helmet style)
  • Rare and looks cool and comes with blaster
  • Colored white (my favorite color)

Cons

  • Lacks detail (such as certain marks and black spots on the helmet)
  • Hard to find
  • Expensive

If you like SW minifigs then this is more your kind of Minifig,but try to find it for a good price.  -Thanks for reading.
